CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 15, 1955, pg. 4 reads: "Vote Fraud Trial Witnesses - Some of the 115 government witnesses of all walks of life who are testifying this week in vote fraud trials of election board members of the Second Precinct, First Ward, in New Kensington, are shown above. Most of the persons testified that they at one time had been registered in the precinct, but did not vote in the 1952 presidential and congressional election which led to the indictments of the board members and New Kensington racketeer Frankie Phillips.  When confronted with their signatures on ballot certificates which showed that a vote had been cast in their name, they replied that the signatures were false.  The Rev. Solomon Cooper, now of Zanesville, Ohio, and who was pastoring in Canonsburg in 1952, and did not vote, is pictured on the extreme left of the picture.  Mrs. Betty Anne Jarnagin of New Kensington and Mrs. Gladys Fishman Williams, now of Portsmouth, Ohio, are the fourth and last persons pictured on the extreme right of the photo. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of witnesses, including Rev. Solomon Cooper on left, Betty Anne Jarnagin fourth from right, and Gladys Fishman Williams on right, gathered in hallway in the Allegheny County Courthouse for voter fraud trial

cutline: Vote Fraud Trial Witnesses - Some of the 115 government witnesses of all walks of life who are testifying this week in vote fraud trials of election board members of the Second Precinct, First Ward, in New Kensington, are shown above. Most of the persons testified that they at one time had been registered in the precinct, but did not vote in the 1952 presidential and congressional election which led to the indictments of the board members and New Kensington racketeer Frankie Phillips.  When confronted with their signatures on ballot certificates which showed that a vote had been cast in their name, they replied that the signatures were false.  The Rev. Solomon Cooper, now of Zanesville, Ohio, and who was pastoring in Canonsburg in 1952, and did not vote, is pictured on the extreme left of the picture.  Mrs. Betty Anne Jarnagin of New Kensington and Mrs. Gladys Fishman Williams, now of Portsmouth, Ohio, are the fourth and last persons pictured on the extreme right of the photo. - Harris Photo.
